56.author: by Phil Yeh
notes: Summary: An 'attempt to provide non comic book readers with an introduction to the comic book industry in America today.' Sections headed 'The Groo Crew' (about Sergio Aragones, Stan Sakai, and Tom Luth), 'Aardvark-Vanaheim, a Canadian Independent Comic Book Firm' (about Joshua Quagmire and Jim Valentino), and 'The Philippines and Comic Book Art' (about Alfredo Alcala and Leandro Martinez).

111.heading: Alcatena, Quique, 1957-
111.title: Les Carnets Secrets de Marco Polo
111.author: Enrique Alcatena ; traduction, Frédéric Dussoubs.
notes: Summary "Vous avez déjà rêvé avec Marco Polo, le plus grand des voyageurs, qui relata ses fameuses aventures de Mongolie, en Chine, au Tonkin, en Perse dans Le livre de Merveilles. Mais ses périples les plus magiques, ses rencontres étranges et surnaturelles, c'est à ses Carnets Secrets qu'il les confia."

135.heading: Alcázar, Vicente, 1944-
135.title: "God of Fear"
135.author: story, Jeff Rovin ; art, Vincente Alcazar
notes: "Uturumcu had slumbered for centuries. Now he had been awakened, called to life by an archaeologist's chant. He glared around the museum angry more than half mad. The havoc he would wreak would become terrifying history!"

136.heading: Alcázar, Vicente, 1944-
136.title: "In Darkness It Shall End!"
136.author: story, Doug Moench ; art, Vincente Alcazar
notes: "Peter stared horrified at Rowena's slashed throat. He had loved her, as did his rival, Ruger. Now she was dead! And only the grave had won. A logical assumption that nearly cost Peter his very life!"

189.author: [No author]

190.heading: Alcohol.
190.title: "Carpinteros"
190.author: argumento de Yolanda Vargas Dulché ; dibujos, Sixto Valencia ; textos, Abel Avendaño
notes: SUMMARY: Ernestillo has been falling asleep in school, and is about to be kicked out. His friends are worried, and Ernestillo says his father is sick and somebody has to finish the carpentry jobs. Actually Ernestillo's father has taken to drink and has become abusive and unproductive. The schoolmates witness the drunken father conversing with Ernestillo's dead mother. The boys begin to help with the carpentry each day after school, until one day Ernestillo doesn't appear in class. They get permission to go to Ernestillo's house during school hours, because they are worried.

262.heading: Alcott, Todd.
262.title: "Rall Nerve : Readers React en-Maus to Attack on Spiegelman" p. 50-51 in The Village Voice, v. 44, no. 31
262.author: [No author]
notes: Letters to the editor about Ted Rall and Art Spiegelman, from Steve Breen, Tony Millionaire, Harvey Pekar, Danny Hellman, Yvonne Mojica, Matthew Wilder, Nancy McClernan, Meghan McKee, Peter Bernard, Mark E. Horowitz, Terry Nantier, Karen Cooper, Benjamin Delfin, Dan Grushkin, Rob Stolzer, Todd Alcott, Rob Rothschild, Chip Kidd, and Chris Ware, with a 2-tier response strip by Ted Rall.
Cover title: "The Cartoon Cavalry Charges to Spiegelman's Defense."
